title: does it matter whether we use .png or .jpg in training data?
body:
I was using png files in my training and the process wouldn't start with this error:
```

/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/keras/callbacks.py:1065: UserWarning: `epsilon` argument is deprecated and will be removed, use `min_delta` instead.
  warnings.warn('`epsilon` argument is deprecated and '
WARNING:tensorflow:From /usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/ops/math_ops.py:3066: to_int32 (from tensorflow.python.ops.math_ops) is deprecated and will be removed in a future version.
Instructions for updating:
Use tf.cast instead.
Epoch 1/4
resizing:  288 288
Cannot find  /content/screens_output/JPEGImages/Screen35
Cannot find  /content/screens_output/JPEGImages/Screen32
Cannot find  /content/screens_output/JPEGImages/Screen09
Cannot find  /content/screens_output/JPEGImages/Screen29
Cannot find  /content/screens_output/JPEGImages/Screen34
Cannot find  /content/screens_output/JPEGImages/Screen12
Cannot find  /content/screens_output/JPEGImages/Screen02
Cannot find  /content/screens_output/JPEGImages/Screen28
Cannot find  /content/screens_output/JPEGImages/Screen26
```

However, the files (in google colab) _are_ there, i've double checked the path etc...

I noticed that when using VOTT by MSFT to generate images, it puts them in a JPEGImages folder... but they are .pngs.... should we only be using jpg or jpeg files for training?


EDIT: Nvm, I converted them all to JPGs and am still receiving the error... I think this has to with google colab and not registering the files on the file system in time or somethingl.....


EDIT:  THe issue was the <filename> attribute in the Annotation xml file generated by VOTT, didn't add the .jpg extension it was just 'Screen26' instead of Screen26.jpg
